pr_title: RULE (Java) Methods and field names should not be the same or differ only by capitalization

timeline.message:
RULE (Java) Methods and field names should not be the same or differ only by capitalization

Made changes to conform to this rule

timeline.bodyText: Is this sort of thing really an issue? I thought it was fine given the variables have clearly defined, different scopes.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: Yeah I'm not really sure. @arcturus2 do you think that its worth changing the variable names?
replies.author: formalhaut69

replies.bodyText:
I think the issue is that it can confuse users of the class. Yes their definitions are clearly defined but unless you happen to know that there are 2 different fields with the same name in the same class, there may be some confusion down the line when you use the wrong one and things aren't happening you expect them to (I expect there are situations where you may be able to pick either one).
Really, this is just poor coding practice more than anything else. Hence this is a code smell and not something like a bug
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText:
Generally I'm a fan of following SonarQube though this particular scenario does seem a little overkill. I think though given the definition of GRAPH and graph is isolated to just this class it is worth resolving the code smell to avoid the chance someone does get confused. I think what this SQ rule is trying to address is important so happy to support it at the end of the day.
As always, nothing is set in stone for me so if there are any objections then happy to revisit it.
replies.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText: I would make this one queryRecordStore, as it is a record store representing a query, not a query of a record store.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: Same deal here as my previous comment.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1
